sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Access to Justice Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Access to Justice Act.

sections.heading: Definitions. As used in this Act:
sections.text: Definitions. As used in this Act:

sections.heading: Fiscal year 2020 grants.  If and only if Senate Bill 262 of the 101st General Assembly becomes law, then funds appropriated for grants in Section 165 of Article 105 of Senate Bill 262 of the 101st General Assembly shall be awarded by the Department of Human Services in equal amounts to the Westside
sections.text: Fiscal year 2020 grants. If and only if Senate Bill 262 of the 101st General Assembly becomes law, then funds appropriated for grants in Section 165 of Article 105 of Senate Bill 262 of the 101st General Assembly shall be awarded by the Department of Human Services in equal amounts to the Westside Justice Center and the Resurrection Project.

sections.heading: Evaluation. The Council shall study the effectiveness of the pilot programs implemented under this Act and submit a report to the Supreme Court, Governor, and General Assembly by June 1, 2021
sections.text: The report shall include the number of people served by the veteran and active military legal hotline and

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
